decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: 10520P01C (location & site plan); 10520P02C (existing & proposed ground floor plans); 10520P04C (proposed elevations)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D1, D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to occupation of the development, enhanced sound insulation of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value shall be implemented for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings, namely, kitchen/living/dining/bathroom above/below/adjoining bedroom of separate dwelling. These mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014 and shall be permanently retained hereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| Prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for the installation in the dwellings of a filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides and particulate matter in the external air. The details to be submitted shall include the arrangements for continuously maintaining the operational efficiency of the system. The ventilation system as approved shall be completed prior to occupation and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by air pollution, in accordance with policy D6 and table 3.2 and SI1 of the London Plan(2021); policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document.

| The individual and combined external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development site shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason:   To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 and table 3.2 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021)

| Equipment/ extraction/ ventilation systems and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site and surrounding premises are not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021)

| The residential units hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | At least two (2) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site and retained thereafter
Reason: to encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan(2021) policy T5 and table 10.2

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided within the foecourt area of the property for the entire building, and made available for use in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 and table 3.2 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Change of use of ground floor shop from business (Use Class E(g)) to residential unit (Use Class C3); single storey rear extension, associated shop front alterations; formation of a forecourt with low front boundary wall with associated refuse storage
